title: Japan's classic win over Scotland rescues the tournament's integrity
text:
The loss of life caused by Typhoon Hagibis meant an unpredictable emotional edge to the qualifying decider between the hosts and Scotland. The Rugby World Cup, Japan and World Rugby all needed this much-in-doubt game to go ahead. The fact that it went ahead on schedule and brought forth another solidly entertaining and intelligent performance from Japan was testament to the resilience of the nation, both in rugby terms and generally.

Make no mistake, this game rescued the integrity of the competition. Having teams eliminated without playing would have left lasting dissatisfaction, not just from the nations eliminated but also many neutral observers.

You have to have sympathy for the hosts and...
description: The loss of life caused by Typhoon Hagibis meant an unpredictable emotional edge to the qualifying decider between the hosts and Scotland.
